title: Add ethereum/poll-logs events
body:
### User Story As a developer, I want an event to poll ethereum logs. Events for logs, blocks and pending transactions should be provided. `poll-logs` should follow the syntax used by [logs](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/6852#issuecomment-441099743) Internally those events will periodically call `eth_getFilterChanges` to get latest changes. Periodicity can be configured by users. ```clojure [ethereum/poll-logs {:value [{:type "uint256" :values ["125"]}] :on-result [some-event]}] ``` `on-result` should be called per result (so array results should be unrolled). Cancels calls `eth_uninstallFilter` and terminates the internal polling. ```clojure [ethereum/cancel-poll-logs {:value id}] ``` Resources: * https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC#eth_getfilterchanges * https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC#eth_newpendingtransactionfilter * https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC#eth_newblockfilter * https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC#eth_newblockfilter ### Description *Type*: Feature

These users each claimed they can complete the work by 2 months, 2 weeks ago.
Please review their action plans below:


**1) [zachzundel](https://gitcoin.co/profile/zachzundel) has been approved to start work.**

I would like to work on this project, using the changes in the PR https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/6852/ as a template to understand a new codebase. 

The description talks about behavior an `on-result` parameter, but this isn't included in the example. Am I just misunderstanding the example?

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/6855/1842).


**2) [tbenr](https://gitcoin.co/profile/tbenr) has applied to start work _(Funders only: [approve worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/6855/1842?mutate_worker_action=approve&worker=tbenr) | [reject worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/6855/1842?mutate_worker_action=reject&worker=tbenr))_.**

already implemented PR for eth_logs, this is related to that PR.

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/6855/1842).
@zachzundel I updated the example and comment
Looks good! I can start as soon as I'm approved. Thanks @jeluard !

Hi @jeluard, so far it looks like I will need to keep some sort of state around to track the currently-polling filters. I am relatively new to Clojure, but have a modest amount of experiment with other Lisp variants. Do you think you could point me towards a good research on how Clojure thinks about state, or maybe redirect me if I'm thinking about the problem incorrectly?

@zachzundel I just created a generic polling event which slightly changes the requirements here (but hopefully simplify things). So no need anymore to handle the polling here.

What we now need is a generic event to create filter (wraps `eth_newBlockFilter`, `eth_newpendingtransactionfilter`):

```
[ethereum/create-filter {:value [{:type "uint256" :values ["125"]}] :on-result [some-event]}]
```

Then an event to get latest changes (wraps `eth_getFilterChanges`):

```
[ethereum/logs-changes {:value id :on-result [some-event]}]
```

And an event to cancel the filter (wraps `eth_uninstallFilter`):

```
[ethereum/cancel-filter {:value id :on-result [some-event]}]
```

Sorry for the inconvenience!

No inconvenience at all! Should `ethereum/create-filter` also wrap `eth_newFilter`? How should I distinguish between a `newBlockFilter` and a `newPendingTransactionFilter` since neither takes any arguments? My current approach just has different events for all three.

One event would be nice! Maybe we could have a type parameter to distinguish between both?

Okay, I think I've done this, but I'm not sure what the best way to test this is. Do you have any recommendations?

Not really actually. Maybe find a simple contract that generates some event and print an alert with the result?

Also do you have a simple extension we could use to test?

I saw your comment! I will make the changes tomorrow. 

Also, I am trying to build an extension, but I can't install it on my phone. When I create it using Pluto, it shows no errors, but I get invalid-key errors when I try and load it using TestFlight. This happens also with example extensions, so I can't get any to work.
@zachzundel To test your changes you will need to access a build with your changes. It's easier if you have an android phone.

I, unfortunately, don't have an Android phone. 

Is there another way we can communicate? (Slack, email, etc.) it seems reasonable to sort out problems unrelated to poll-logs elsewhere.

Sure please join status! My ENS username is julien!
